I have decided to implement a RESTful "mail" system.  The design I have come
up with is incredibly simple, flexible, and (i believe) even RESTful (no,
really!).  However, before I get too deep into its design, I thought I would
look around at what others are doing.  Anyone know of any RESTful (from the
ground up, preferably) "mail" systems out there already?


In the end, my objective is to get a simple, easily visible RESTful
application on the web and used by lots of people (the latter part is
possibly more important that the former part).  As I have been reading the
"visibility" thread, I got to thinking that (other than letting people
discover for themselves the pitfalls of RPC) people would be more receptive
to REST if they could actually see something RESTful.  I know the Web itself
is RESTful, but it's hard to convince someone of the legitimacy of a term
that came after the application that demonstrated it.  Coming up with
something *new* would, imho, be an easier thing to digest and understand to
the REST skeptics out there.


To that end, if anyone is interested in working with me on this, I will
happily share my thoughts.  I think it's highly workable, and would
certainly be more successful if it were a group effort.
